questions.question: If 30% of the surface area of a runway is covered by surface water more than 3 mm deep, by slush, by loose snow or compacted snow which resists further compression, or ice (including wet ice), the runway is classified as:
If the surface of a runway is not dry, but the moisture on it does not give a shiny appearance, the runway is:
If a runway is covered with water which is less than 3 mm deep, or where the surface appears reflective but without standing water patches, it is said to be:
A dry runway is one which:
options: can be wet if it has sufficient camber to allow the water to drain quickly off the surface therefore maintaining an 'effective dry' braking action
is wet but not to a depth of water greater than 3 mm
can be wet if it has specially prepared grooved or porous surfaces, which maintain 'effectively dry' braking action
questions.solution: can be wet if it has specially prepared grooved or porous surfaces, which maintain 'effectively dry' braking action

questions.question: If a runway is contaminated with dry snow, the depth that will preclude operations is:
If a runway is contaminated with wet snow, slush or water, the depth that will preclude operations is:
The effect whereby a tyre is lifted from the runway due to aeroplane speed along the runway is known as:
For any given contaminant (by specific gravity), the aquaplaning speed is given by:
options: nine times the square of the tyre pressure (lb/sqin)
the tyre pressure (bars) divided by nine
nine times the square root of the tyre pressure (lb/sqin)
the square root of the tyre pressure (bars) multiplied by nine
questions.solution: nine times the square root of the tyre pressure (lb/sqin)

questions.question: One bar (barometric pressure unit) is equal to:
Braking action on contaminated runways is given by:
options: a simple code (1-5) or a description (excellent - bad)
a simple code (0.25-0.4) or a description (good - bad)
a simple code (1-5), a description (good - poor) or the measured coefficient of braking effect (<0.25->0.40)
the coefficient of braking action related to a simple code where 1 is poor and 5 is good, supplemented by a description of the braking effect and an aquaplaning warning
questions.solution: a simple code (1-5), a description (good - poor) or the measured coefficient of braking effect (<0.25->0.40)

questions.question: Apart from aquaplaning and reduced braking efficiency, what other hazards are associated with heavy rain contamination of runways?
options: Wet aeroplanes do not perform as well as dry ones
The efficiency of jet engines is reduced by the ingress of water diluting the fuel
The refraction of light from landing lights causes visual impairment
Water ingress into engines can cause flame-out
questions.solution: Water ingress into engines can cause flame-out
